title: How do i write only a bootsector to a USB-Stick?

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
Had to move the whole contents of a USB-BootStick to a new one. Unfortunately, i noticed only today, that i forgot to copy the bootsector too.  

Is there a way to just write the bootsector (for NTLDR) to the USB-Stick without, having to format it too?  
Seems RMPrepUSB does not offer this option.  

![:happy_dance:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/celebrate14.gif)

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: only grub4dos. Otherwise use BootIce? Or maybe bootsect /nt52 ?

forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content:
> Is there a way to just write the bootsector (for NTLDR) to the USB-Stick without, having to format it too?  
Sure. If you post your boot sector, I will post a modified one for NTLDR. Or you could boot **Recovery Console** and use the [**FIXBOOT** command](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/314058 "External link").

forumNotes.author: MedEvil
forumNotes.content:
Tryed Bootice. Looked nice and seemed to work. However the PE will still not boot, not even an error message.  
No idea what the problem is, but also have no time to investigate.  
Thanks for the help!
